Notes.Text:
This update for libmspack fixes the following issues:

Security issues fixed:

- CVE-2019-1010305: Fixed a buffer overflow triggered by a crafted chm file
  which could have led to information disclosure (bsc#1141680).
- CVE-2018-18584: The CAB block input buffer was one byte too small for the 
  maximal Quantum block, leading to an out-of-bounds write. (bsc#1113038)
- CVE-2018-18585: chmd_read_headers accepted a filename that has '\0' as its 
  first or second character (such as the '/\0' name). (bsc#1113039)
- Fix off-by-one bounds check on CHM PMGI/PMGL chunk numbers and reject empty filenames.
Notes.Title: Details

SUSE Linux Enterprise Software Development Kit 12 SP5

Vulnerabilities.Description: In mspack/cab.h in libmspack before 0.8alpha and cabextract before 1.8, the CAB block input buffer is one byte too small for the maximal Quantum block, leading to an out-of-bounds write.

ProductID: SUSE Linux Enterprise Server for SAP Applications 12 SP5:libmspack0-0.4-15.7.1
SUSE Linux Enterprise Software Development Kit 12 SP5:libmspack-devel-0.4-15.7.1

Vulnerabilities.Description: chmd_read_headers in mspack/chmd.c in libmspack before 0.8alpha accepts a filename that has '\0' as its first or second character (such as the "/\0" name).

ProductID: SUSE Linux Enterprise Server for SAP Applications 12 SP5:libmspack0-0.4-15.7.1
SUSE Linux Enterprise Software Development Kit 12 SP5:libmspack-devel-0.4-15.7.1

Vulnerabilities.Description: libmspack 0.9.1alpha is affected by: Buffer Overflow. The impact is: Information Disclosure. The component is: function chmd_read_headers() in libmspack(file libmspack/mspack/chmd.c). The attack vector is: the victim must open a specially crafted chm file. The fixed version is: after commit 2f084136cfe0d05e5bf5703f3e83c6d955234b4d.

ProductID: SUSE Linux Enterprise Server for SAP Applications 12 SP5:libmspack0-0.4-15.7.1
SUSE Linux Enterprise Software Development Kit 12 SP5:libmspack-devel-0.4-15.7.1
